description: Triangle of Stirling numbers of first kind, s(n,k), n >= 0, 0<=k<=n.
comments: The unsigned numbers are also called Stirling cycle numbers: |s(n,k)| = number of permutations of n objects with exactly k cycles.Mirror image of the triangle A054654. - _Philippe Deléham_, Dec 30 2006Also the triangle gives coefficients T(n,k) of x^k in the expansion of C(x,n) = (a(k)*x^k)/n!. -  _Mokhtar Mohamed_, Dec 04 2012

formula: s(n, k)=s(n-1, k-1)-(n-1)*s(n-1, k), n, k >= 1; s(n, 0)=s(0, k)=0; s(0, 0)=1.The unsigned numbers a(n, k)=|s(n, k)| satisfy a(n, k)=a(n-1, k-1)+(n-1)*a(n-1, k), n, k >= 1; a(n, 0)=a(0, k)=0; a(0, 0)=1.Triangle (signed) = [0, -1, -1, -2, -2, -3, -3, -4, -4, ...] DELTA [1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, ...]; Triangle(unsigned) = [0, 1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, ...] DELTA [1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 0, ...]; where DELTA is Deléham's operator defined in A084938.Sum_{k=0..n} (-m)^(n-k)*T(n, k) = A000142(n), A001147(n), A007559(n), A007696(n), ... for m = 1, 2, 3, 4, ... .- _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 29 2005A008275*A007318 as infinite lower triangular matrices. [_Gerald McGarvey_, Aug 20 2009]Bivariate e.g.f.: exp(x*log(1+t)). - _Peter Luschny_, Dec 30 2010
